newsitem.title: UK: Hepworth sounds cautious note on strong stg.
newsitem.headline: Hepworth sounds cautious note on strong stg.

text.p: British building materials suppplier Hepworth Plc said on Thursday the underlying outlook for 1997 was positive but sterling's strength was expected to hit overseas earnings and impair export margins.
Hepworth, announcing a 9.3 percent drop in pretax profits in 1996 to 67.6 million pounds ($110.1 million), said a further increase in its pension charge would also impact earnings this year.

"1997 will be a challenging year for the group as sterling's recent rise against major European currencies will impact translation of overseas earnings and impair export margins," Hepworth said in a statement.
Hepworth said it would take what it called vigorous action to cut its cost base.

"Nevertheless, the underlying outlook is positive. United Kingdom construction and home improvement markets are showing signs of modest recovery," Hepworth said, adding that its continental heating operations were experiencing firmer demand.
The company proposed paying an unchanged total dividend for 1996 of 14.85 pence. Sales rose 1.6 percent to 777.8 million pounds. ($ = 0.614 British Pounds)
